course_title: Special Topics in Linguistics: Languages Across Metro Atlanta
class_notes:
This one-credit course is an introduction into the vibrant multilingual and multicultural metropolitan Atlanta area. After a brief overview of the history of Atlanta with specific focus on the increasing multiculturalism of the city, the course will introduce students to the theory and practice of linguistic landscape research with the goal of involving students in the observation, documentation, and analysis of different linguistic communities throughout metro Atlanta.
Because the linguistic landscape to be examined is found out in the city, outings into the city both during and outside class time will be conducted. In addition, course participants will look to showcase their own research into Atlanta's linguistic landscape on a course website.
No prior experience with linguistic landscape research required for participation in the course.


Assessment criteria
1. Participation (25%)
2. Homework (25%)
3. Final project (40%)
4. Website development (10%)
course_description: Investigation of a particular issue or topic in the study of language, linguistics, and communication. May be repeated when topic varies. Topics may include: the Romance languages; intercultural communication; words and the world; language and human nature.
